decision_conditions: Prior to occupation of uses falling under E(g)(iii) (Industrial processes), details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority, of the composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope demonstrating that noise from uses and activities is contained within the building, with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided. The assessment shall be according to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified by BS8233:2014, at the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises incl. private external amenity spaces. The approved sound insulation and ventilation shall be implemented before the development is commenced and retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The opening hours of units 9 & 10 Parkside Yards, shall not be permitted outside of 07:00 to 23:00 Mondays to Sunday including and Public/Bank Holidays. The opening hours of all other premises shall not be permitted outside of 07:00 to 22:30 Mondays to Sunday including and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The development expires on 15 March 2034 when the building(s) and the use carried out under this permission, and the previous planning permission (178801FUL), shall be removed and the land reinstated to the satisfaction of the local planning authority.

Reason: The temporary nature of the development is such that it is considered inappropriate on a permanent basis in the interests of the regeneration of this important strategic regeneration site and in accordance with policy SOU5 of the adopted Ealing Development Sites DPD (2013).
description: Application for non-material amendment to planning permission reference 224066FUL dated 16.03.2023 for Change of use of part ground floor, from residents facilities (Use Class  Sui Generis) to shop/restaurant/cafe/financial and professional services (Mixed Use Class E(a)/E(b)/E(c))'. Amendment seeks to amend the wording of condition 4 to match the wording approved under 231465NMA; amendment to condition 6 to extend the opening hours for units 9 10 from 22.30 Monday-Sunday to Mon-Sun to 23:00; amendment to condition 8 extend temporary planning consent from 15th March 2028-15th March 2034
